alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 09 at 7:36PM EST until March 10 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 2 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed freezing rain and snow expected. Total ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch expected. Locally higher amounts are possible for locations above 4,000 feet in elevation. Snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches possible. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Pocahontas and Southeast Randolph Counties. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 2 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Stronger winds and accumulating snow are possible behind the system Friday night into Saturday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.
